sense.name: strike with horror, surprise, disgust
sense.examples: Again we shocked the industry when we offered our magnetic stripe readers for under 50 dollars! It shocked politicians enough to denounce arts funding. The callousness of the so-called educated upperclasses shocked him even more. The novel was meant to shock. His heart attack shocked him into eating better and exercising.

sense.name: subject to an electrical shock
sense.examples: So we shocked him and did some CPR, all according to our training. I shocked him at 300J and got a pulse back. The suspect says officers shocked him with a stun gun five times.

sense.name: inflict trauma to a system
sense.examples: The next day I shocked the pool and put two chlorine tablets in the floating device. Adrenaline kicked in and an immediate redistribution of blood shocked his system.

sense.name: gather into shocks
sense.examples: He rode the binder at wheat harvest while the rest of the family shocked the grain bundles.

sense.name: collide violently
sense.examples: Here for many a day shocked together the Spaniard and the Moor. The two bodies had shocked together like a college rush.
